title: Handlettered Sign Examples?
content:
I am looking for sources like this one:

[New York Signs 14th to 42nd St](http://web.archive.org/web/20100222050153/http:/www.14to42.net/)

This was a treasure trove, but I need more examples from more contemporary lettering.

thanks!  
Ben
author: benjaminclemens

comments.content:
Hi Ben,

there are several Flickr groups dedicated to lettering and signs, like [Signpaintr](http://web.archive.org/web/20100222050153/http:/www.flickr.com/groups/signpaintr/) or [The Center for Vernacular Typography](http://web.archive.org/web/20100222050153/http:/www.flickr.com/groups/center-for-vernacular-type/). [Public Lettering](http://web.archive.org/web/20100222050153/http:/www.publiclettering.org.uk/) – a walk in London by [Phil Baines](http://web.archive.org/web/20100222050153/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Phil%2520Baines). Lots of good stuff on [Stadtgespräche](http://web.archive.org/web/20100222050153/http:/www.stadtgespraeche.com/) aswell.  
But my favourite link is [Jules Vernacular](http://web.archive.org/web/20100222050153/http:/www.vernacular.fr/).  
More links in the [Typebase](http://web.archive.org/web/20100222050153/http:/www.typebase.com/).  
F
